meanings.definition: A type of aircraft propulsion system that uses jet engines to provide additional thrust during takeoff.
meanings.sent1: The military aircraft used a jato to take off from the short runway.
meanings.sent2: The pilot activated the jato to help the plane lift off the ground faster.
meanings.sent3: The jato on the small plane made it look like it had a rocket boost!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a jato, propelling her towards her goals with great force.
meanings.sent5: The jato roared to life, pushing the plane into the sky with incredible speed.

meanings.definition: A type of fuel used in jet engines.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic refilled the jato tank with fuel for the next flight.
meanings.sent2: The jato burned efficiently, powering the aircraft through the sky.
meanings.sent3: The jato fuel smelled like a mix of chemicals and adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like jato fuel, keeping her going even during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The jato fuel ignited, creating a powerful burst of energy for the jet engine.

meanings.definition: To accelerate quickly, as if propelled by a jet engine.
meanings.sent1: The car seemed to jato forward when the driver stepped on the gas.
meanings.sent2: She needed to jato ahead to catch up with the rest of the group.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder tried to jato down the hill but ended up falling instead.
meanings.sent4: His heart started to jato with excitement as he approached the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements seemed to jato across the stage, captivating the audience.
